content:
I'm seeing what appears to be an inconsistency in the slicing of the PDex Provenance.agent element, where...

  • the agent:All Slices definition binds agent.type to US Core Provenance Participant Type Codes (which includes a "transmitter" code) as extensible
  • the agent:ProvenanceTransmitter slice binds agent.type to ProvenanceParticipantType -- which doesn't contain a "transmitter" code -- as extensible

I see that the IG's transmitter examples use the "transmitter" code included in the US Core value set, and since the agent:ProvenanceTransmitter's type binding is extensible, that works.

Just wondering if there's any additional meaning to the different binding in the agent:ProvenanceTransmitter slice that I'm missing.

Hi @Mark Scrimshire
Hoping you could take a quick look at the note above regarding the PDex Provenance.agent.type valueset bindings. Just checking whether there's a reason for the ProvenanceTransmitter slice being different than the AllSlices definition. I'm wondering if this relates to something about slicing or bindings that I'm not familiar with.
Thanks!
